channel.title: Systems Administration on Aggregated Thinking
channel.description: Recent content in Systems Administration on Aggregated Thinking

item.title: Moving Forward
item.description: In a month’s time, I would be transferring offices again. I started from a very technical department, under the administration cluster.

item.title: Got Static!
item.description: I just made the first step towards moving my whole blog to GitHub and going all static! Content is generated by Pelican, a static site generator, written in Python.

item.title: Racking Legacy Servers - Part 1
item.description: Earlier today we scheduled the racking of our old C-Class HP BladeSystem. It used to be wrapped in its own enclosure with wheels to boot, but it didn’t make sense to have it stand outside the cabinets.

item.title: on SLMIS
item.description: End users complain because the system isn’t “user-friendly”. FYI, it’s meant to be that way. It’s the only way we can guarantee that the system will still be helpful 25 years from now.

item.title: GWF Team CDO
item.description: Woot! ^_^ Hardwyrd - Aug 3, 2011Woot! ^_^ We should plan for a bigger get-together. What say you?

item.title: GWF Team CDO
item.description: We’ve come a long way since 2006; but it wasn’t until 2009 that we had a solid team based in CDO.

item.title: Have you updated?
item.description: jon@jedi-ntbk:~$ lsb_release -a LSB Version: core-2.0-ia32:core-2.0-noarch:core-3.0-ia32:core-3.0-noarch:core-3.1-ia32:core-3.1-noarch:core-3.2-ia32:core-3.2-noarch:core-4.0-ia32:core-4.0-noarch Distributor ID: Ubuntu Description: Ubuntu 10.04.3 LTS Release: 10.04 Codename: lucid

item.title: End-of-the-month TODOs
item.description: I have again changed the look of my tech blog. I’ve actually mulled over this for quite some time since I was also thinking of just moving everything to my own hosted Wordpress install.

item.title: SVN-MantisBT Integration
item.description: I’ve downloaded and installed MantisBT 1.2.3stable on linode2, and after fixing permissions issues, proceeded with the installation. I stopped when I realized I didn’t have the same MantisBT version on the old server.

item.title: Linux Kernel Tuning for C500k | Urban Airship Blog
item.description: By Jared “Lucky” Kuolt on September 29, 2010 Like the idea of working on large scale problems? We’re hiring talented engineers, and would love to chat with you – check it out!

item.title: How to count instances of an IP address in a log file
item.description: I was looking for a quick and painless way to determine what IP addresses used our web app the most and stumbled across this excellent post.

item.title: Putty on my phone FTW! ISP was acting up and was able to get Apache to work sometime past 3pm. Post-mortem shortly.
item.description: via Gravity

item.title: Being a Systems Administrator @37signals (Podcast)
item.description: I use Basecamp a lot. Kudos to these guys for making my job as a Systems Administrator more bearable than usual.

item.title: How big is a Yottabyte? - Holy Kaw!
item.description: And I got a long way to go. My next step doesn’t happen in the next couple of months, and that’s when I purchase a terabyte external hard drive for storage purposes.

item.title: Using non-standard SSH port with TortoiseSVN
item.description: I should note that that code gets added into /home… devkinetic - May 4, 2010I should note that that code gets added into /home/USERNAME/.

item.title: Using non-standard SSH port with TortoiseSVN
item.description: Some of my students reported that they were having problems connecting to their repositories using TortoiseSVN. At first, quick checks from my end didn’t reveal what caused these, but I realized soon that it wasn’t a server issue.

item.title: Now I got the itch to shell script this [http://bash.org/?910094]
item.description: Doug should just stick to doing “point!” :D eclair: Awwww, Doug is so cute here. Look at those eyes and ears!

item.title: PIIX3 cannot attach drive to the Secondary Master
item.description: I use VirtualBox for my server experimenting requirements, and it’s just great! Just this morning, I got an error message when I started an FC8 virtual machine.

item.title: More Plesk Blues
item.description: I’ve had this problem with Plesk since I started relying heavily on it in 2006. For some reason, after you’ve added your client, allocated IP address to client’s pool, added a domain, and selecting physical hosting, you get the message:

item.title: on work and blogging
item.description: i haven’t been updating for several important, albeit lousy reasons. work has been keeping me up at nights and i feel that if i were to write entries, i wouldn’t be making much sense.

item.title: Pushing on
item.description: I recently got Ubuntu Feisty Fawn Beta running on my HP Pavilion dv2001tu notebook, and I’m very happy with the way it’s running.
